snippet: The case is a sequel to a 2007 decision involving the Environmental Protection Agency’s responsibility to regulate greenhouse gases from motor vehicles.
abstract: Supreme Court agrees to hear major case challenging Environmental Protection Agency regulations of greenhouse gas emissions from stationary sources like power plants; case is sequel of sorts to 2007 decision involving agency's responsibility to regulate greenhouse gases from motor vehicles.
lead_paragraph: The case is a sequel to a 2007 decision involving the Environmental Protection Agency’s responsibility to regulate greenhouse gases from motor vehicles.

headline.main: Supreme Court to Hear Challenge to E.P.A. Rules on Gas Emissions
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court to Hear Challenge to E.P.A. Rules on Gas Emissions
